Temp: The current temperature in Celsius, for reference.
Time: The current time, usually in UTC (Coordinated Universal Time).
push to face north: The direction you should push back.
C-N-N2: The specific path of taxiways to follow to the runway.
Runway: The designated runway for takeoff or landing.
QNH: Altimeter setting for the local atmospheric pressure.
Squawk Code: A four-digit transponder code assigned by ATC.
Chittagong: The name of your destination airport.
SID: Standard Instrument Departure name, a predefined flight path.
ADMIL ONE: A specific Standard Instrument Departure route.
FL: A standard altitude for cruise flight, measured in hundreds of feet.
FL-130: An initial altitude to climb to after takeoff, measured in hundreds of feet.
260/60kts: Surface wind direction in degrees (260) and speed in knots (60).
Airborne Time: The time the aircraft becomes airborne.
4000ft: A specific altitude to report back to ATC when you reach it.
Dhaka Control: The name of the Air Traffic Control unit to contact.
126.7: The radio frequency of the next ATC unit.
